intro: Ouratea trollii, commonly known as the red-topped ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red calyx that persists on the fruit, giving it a striking appearance. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ouratea trollii produces small, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
